ygData.subject: Re: Test of Truth info
ygData.msgSnippet: ... I believe it would be as follows: Sir Hamish Alexander Dame Honor Harrington If there is a nobility title (King, Baron, Lady, Countess, etc...) it goes
ygData.messageBody:
--- CybrWzrd <CybrWzrd@...> wrote:
> Also Sir would not work, because there are lady
> Paladins too

I believe it would be as follows:

Sir Hamish Alexander
Dame Honor Harrington

If there is a nobility title (King, Baron, Lady,
Countess, etc...) it goes before the Knight's title:

Earl Sir Hamish Alexander
Lady Dame Honor Harrington

And finally (those crazy British nobles), if there's a
military title too; it goes before them all; though it
would be a rare occasion to use all three titles when
refering to the individual:

Captain Sir Hamish Alexander
Captain Earl Sir Hamish Alexander
Captain Dame Honor Harrington
Captain Lady Dame Honor Harrington

etc...
(bored at work)
:P

===
:D

"People will believe a lie either because they want to
believe it's true, or because they fear it is." Wizard's
First Rule, Sword of Truth, Terry Goodkind
